name: Carthage (Arrakis)
context: The capital city of the desert planet Arrakis (Dune). Hot, arid, spice-filled air, brutalist architecture, twin moons, sandy streets.

name: Castle Caladan
context: The ancestral home of House Atreides on the water planet Caladan. Stormy seas, lush green cliffs, ancient stone castle, rain, fog.

name: Barony (Giedi Prime)
context: The industrial capital of Giedi Prime (House Harkonnen). Dark, polluted, oppressive, black sun, obsidian architecture, green smog.

name: Cinth (Kaitain)
context: The golden capital of the Padishah Emperor on Kaitain. Opulent, lavish gardens, crystal spires, clear blue skies, futuristic luxury.

name: Minas Tirith (Gondor)
context: The White City of Gondor in Middle-earth. Seven tiered levels carved from white stone, backed by Mount Mindolluin, beacon tower, medieval fantasy.

name: Edoras (Rohan)
context: The capital of Rohan. A golden hall (Meduseld) atop a grassy hill, wooden structures, windy plains, mountains in the distance.

name: Rivendell (Elven)
context: The Last Homely House east of the Sea. Elven architecture blending with nature, waterfalls, autumn leaves, magical valley, misty.

name: Barad-dûr (Mordor)
context: The Dark Tower of Sauron in Mordor. Volcanic landscape, lava flows, dark ominous clouds, the Eye of Sauron watching, jagged spires.

name: Hobbiton (The Shire)
context: The Shire in Middle-earth. Green rolling hills, round hobbit holes with colorful doors, peaceful farming village, sunny, cozy.

name: Caras Galadhon (Lothlórien)
context: The city of the Galadhrim elves. Giant mallorn trees, flets (platforms) high in the branches, silver and gold lights, ethereal forest.

name: King's Landing (Westeros)
context: The capital of the Seven Kingdoms. Red Keep on the hill, dense medieval city, terracotta roofs, Blackwater Bay, sunny Mediterranean vibe.

name: Winterfell (The North)
context: The seat of House Stark. Ancient grey granite castle, hot springs steam, godswood with red leaves, cold snowy weather, wolf statues.

name: Pyke (Iron Islands)
context: The castle of House Greyjoy. Dark stone towers on jagged sea stacks connected by rope bridges, stormy grey ocean, crashing waves, bleak and powerful.

name: The Eyrie (The Vale)
context: The seat of House Arryn high in the mountains. White stone castle perched on a peak, clouds below, Moon Door, vertigo-inducing heights, cold thin air.

name: Braavos (Essos)
context: The Free City of Braavos. Canals, the Titan of Braavos statue guarding the harbor, fog, stone houses, Venetian style, mysterious assassins.

name: Coruscant (Galactic City)
context: The entire planet is one city. Endless skyscrapers, flying car traffic lanes in the sky, neon lights, futuristic, industrial haze.

name: Mos Eisley (Tatooine)
context: A wretched hive of scum and villainy. Desert spaceport, twin suns, dome buildings, sandy streets, landspeeders, alien vibe.

name: Theed (Naboo)
context: The capital of Naboo. Classical architecture with domes, waterfalls, lush green parks, peaceful, elegant, by the river.

name: Echo Base (Hoth)
context: Rebel base on the ice planet Hoth. Snowy trenches, icy plains, AT-AT walkers on the horizon, cold, blue and white aesthetic.

name: Cloud City (Bespin)
context: A city floating in the clouds. Orange sunset sky, art deco futuristic towers, mining platforms, tibanna gas fumes, dreamy.

name: Great Sphinx (Giza)
context: The Great Sphinx of Giza with the Pyramids in the background. Desert sand, ancient stone, blue sky, camels, historical majesty.

name: Eiffel Tower (Paris)
context: The Eiffel Tower towering over Paris. Champ de Mars gardens, iron lattice work, romantic atmosphere, Seine river nearby.

name: Great Wall (China)
context: The Great Wall of China winding through green mountains. Stone fortifications, mist, steep steps, ancient history.

name: Taj Mahal (Agra)
context: The white marble mausoleum. Reflecting pool, symmetrical gardens, minarets, sunrise lighting, serene and beautiful.

name: Machu Picchu (Peru)
context: Ancient Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains. Stone ruins, terraces, green peaks, clouds, llamas.

name: Lambeau Field (Green Bay)
context: The Frozen Tundra. NFL stadium, green grass, snow falling, packed stands, historic football atmosphere.

name: Wembley Stadium (London)
context: Iconic football stadium with the famous Arch. Green pitch, massive crowd, modern architecture, electric atmosphere.

name: Fenway Park (Boston)
context: Historic baseball park. The Green Monster wall, red seats, urban city backdrop, sunny day at the ballpark.

name: Camp Nou (Barcelona)
context: Massive football stadium. Blue and red seats, immense scale, passion, Catalan flags, sunny Mediterranean weather.

name: Madison Square Garden
context: The World's Most Famous Arena. Indoor basketball/hockey setting, bright lights, packed vertical seating, intense energy.

name: Wrigleyville (Chicago)
context: The neighborhood around Wrigley Field. Red brick buildings, rooftop bleachers, baseball atmosphere, lively streets, L train passing.

name: Lincoln Park (Chicago)
context: Green park by the lake, zoo entrance, brownstone row houses, tree-lined streets, view of the skyline.

name: Bronzeville (Chicago)
context: Historic metropolis of the Black Belt. Greystone buildings, jazz history murals, boulevards, cultural vibrancy.

name: The Loop (Chicago)
context: Downtown Chicago. Elevated train tracks over the street, skyscrapers, hustle and bustle, Chicago River bridges.

name: Wicker Park (Chicago)
context: Trendy neighborhood. Victorian mansions, artistic vibe, Six Corners intersection, cafes, street art.
